dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Elon Musk's net worth is almost entirely tied up in Tesla and SpaceX stock, which is a huge deal for his current legal situation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Elon Musk's net worth is almost entirely tied up in Tesla and SpaceX stock, which is a huge deal for his current legal situation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity. If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. I mean, uh, Forbes estimates that as much as 99% of his wealth is in those two companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. I mean, uh, Forbes estimates that as much as ninety nine percent of his wealth is in those two companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so when he says he doesn't have a lot of liquid cash, he's not kidding. He even declined his base salary of $56,380 back in 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so when he says he doesn't have a lot of liquid cash, he's not kidding. He even declined his base salary of fifty six thousand, three hundred eighty dollars back in twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont. ... In 2018, for instance, the bulk of his compensation at Tesla came in the form of stock options. Musk declined to accept his base salary of $56,380.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And on top of that, he's got over $500 million in debts, including huge loans from Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And on top of that, he's got over five hundred dollars million in debts, including huge loans from Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More important, Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year. That includes $208.9 million in liabilities owed to Morgan Stanley and $213 million borrowed from an affiliate of Goldman Sachs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is why if there's a big judgment against him, he might have to sell shares—something he's really avoided doing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why if there's a big judgment against him, he might have to sell shares-something he's really avoided doing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild to think that someone with a fortune like his could be cash-poor, but it makes sense when you see how much is tied up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild to think that someone with a fortune like his could be cash-poor, but it makes sense when you see how much is tied up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And you know, his whole career has been about taking huge risks, like with SpaceX. He even called it a "terrible risk-adjusted return."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you know, his whole career has been about taking huge risks, like with SpaceX. He even called it a terrible risk-adjusted return.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is not the path to go to maximize riches, he told Forbes in 2012, referring to SpaceX. Its a terrible risk-adjusted return.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But that's the thing—he's always said it's not about the money. It's about impacting humanity's future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's the thing-he's always said it's not about the money. It's about impacting humanity's future.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead he founded the space exploration company, he said, because it was his way to most affect the future of humanity and civilization. He has made similar comments about his motivations at Tesla.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Though lately, some of his actions, like that Cybertruck window shattering incident, have been pretty distracting from that vision.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though lately, some of his actions, like that Cybertruck window shattering incident, have been pretty distracting from that vision.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, during the introduction of Teslas new Cybertruck, he attempted to prove the durability of the trucks armor glass windows with a metal ball. Instead the window shattered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, that was something else. "Oh my God," he said when the glass broke. But hey, 250,000 preorders anyway!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, that was something else. Oh my God, he said when the glass broke. But hey, two hundred fifty thousand preorders anyway!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oh my fing God, said a surprised Musk. Still, Musk reports that more than 250,000 customers have preordered the vehicle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then he gets Innovator of the Year from the SEC right after? Talk about irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then he gets Innovator of the Year from the S E C right after? Talk about irony.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he tweeted about needing improvements—classic Musk humor, but it just adds to the drama.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he tweeted about needing improvements-classic Musk humor, but it just adds to the drama.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But, he tweeted, Guess we have some improvements to make before production haha.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's this constant mix of groundbreaking innovation and, like, public missteps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's this constant mix of groundbreaking innovation and, like, public missteps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. You've got to wonder how it all plays out with his financial obligations hanging over him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. You've got to wonder how it all plays out with his financial obligations hanging over him.

artist_script:
HostA: Elon Musk's net worth is almost entirely tied up in Tesla and SpaceX stock, which is a huge deal for his current legal situation.
HostB: Yeah, exactly. I mean, uh, Forbes estimates that as much as 99% of his wealth is in those two companies.
HostA: Right, so when he says he doesn't have a lot of liquid cash, he's not kidding. He even declined his base salary of $56,380 back in 2018.
HostB: And on top of that, he's got over $500 million in debts, including huge loans from Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs.
HostA: Which is why if there's a big judgment against him, he might have to sell shares—something he's really avoided doing.
HostB: It's wild to think that someone with a fortune like his could be cash-poor, but it makes sense when you see how much is tied up.
HostA: And you know, his whole career has been about taking huge risks, like with SpaceX. He even called it a "terrible risk-adjusted return."
HostB: But that's the thing—he's always said it's not about the money. It's about impacting humanity's future.
HostA: Though lately, some of his actions, like that Cybertruck window shattering incident, have been pretty distracting from that vision.
HostB: Oh man, that was something else. "Oh my God," he said when the glass broke. But hey, 250,000 preorders anyway!
HostA: And then he gets Innovator of the Year from the SEC right after? Talk about irony.
HostB: Yeah, and he tweeted about needing improvements—classic Musk humor, but it just adds to the drama.
HostA: It's this constant mix of groundbreaking innovation and, like, public missteps.
HostB: Exactly. You've got to wonder how it all plays out with his financial obligations hanging over him.
